curam.util.client.domain.convert

Class CodeTableCodeConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.common.plugin.AbstractPlugIn
      • curam.util.common.domain.AbstractDomainPlugIn
        • curam.util.client.domain.AbstractClientDomainPlugIn
          • curam.util.client.domain.convert.AbstractConverter
            • curam.util.client.domain.convert.SvrStringConverter
              • curam.util.client.domain.convert.CodeTableCodeConverter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    curam.util.client.domain.convert.ClientDomainConverter, DomainConverter, curam.util.client.domain.convert.FilteredDomainConverter, DomainPlugIn, PlugIn

    public class CodeTableCodeConverter
extends SvrStringConverter
implements curam.util.client.domain.convert.FilteredDomainConverter
    A converter for code-table code items. Most code-table code domains are descendants of the reference application's CODETABLE_CODE domain, but any other domain could act as a code-table "root" domain. When parsing, the parsed code is expected to be a code-table item code value and is converted into a curam.util.common.util.CodeItem object. When pre-validating, only the size domain options are checked against the item code value. When formatting, the code is converted to its corresponding description; the localized description is already available on the CodeItem object.

      • parse

        public java.lang.Object parse(java.lang.String data)
                       throws ConversionException
        Returns a CodeItem for the given item code string. The code string must not be empty or null and must represent a valid code on the code-table associated with the domain for the active locale.
        Specified by:
        parse in interface DomainConverter
        Overrides:

      • format

        public java.lang.String format(java.lang.Object data)
                        throws ConversionException
        Formats the code by translating it to its corresponding description. If the locale on the code does not match the current locale, it is re-translated. Translation is performed by calling the CodeTableCodeConverter.parse(String) method on the code value and then returning the description, so the code must not be empty or null and must represent a valid code on the code-table associated with the domain for the active locale.
        Specified by:
        format in interface DomainConverter
        Overrides:
        format in class AbstractConverter
        Parameters:
        data - The data object to the formatted.
        Returns:
        The string representation of the data.
        Throws:
        ConversionException - If the formatting fails.
        See Also:
        DomainConverter.format(Object)

      • parseGeneric

        public java.lang.Object parseGeneric(java.lang.String data)
                              throws ConversionException
        Parses the data and returns a CodeItem object using the data as the code value. Only the code is set; the description, locale, sort order, and enabled flag are not set. The description will be created when the code is localized during formatting for the user's locale.
        Specified by:
        parseGeneric in interface DomainConverter
        Overrides:

      • getDomainClass

        public java.lang.Class<?> getDomainClass()

        Gets the class that is used for the native Java representation of data in this domain. The converter's format should be able to format instances of this class and the parse method should return instances of this class.

        The client infrastructure will use this class to ensure that the converter methods are not passed an object of an incompatible type by checking this class in the implementation of the acceptData(Object) method inherited from the AbstractConverter base class.

        Specified by:
        getDomainClass in interface DomainConverter
        Overrides:
        getDomainClass in class SvrStringConverter
        Returns:
        The curam.util.common.util.CodeItem class.
